paper_abstract: With inspiration from the economic reality, where numbers are basic entities to work with, we propose a genuinely new kind of P systems, where numerical variables evolve, starting from initial values, by means of production functions and repartition protocols. We prove that non-deterministic systems of this type, using polynomial production functions, characterize the Turing computable sets of natural numbers, while deterministic systems, with polynomial production functions having non-negative coefficients, compute strictly more than semilinear sets of natural numbers. A series of research topics to be addressed in this framework are mentioned.
paper_title: Membrane computing and economics: Numerical P systems
